issue.title: Allow configuration file to define multiple DefinitionProvider
issue.body:
While having only 1 `DefinitionProvider` in the actual runtime code makes it easy to know precisely what third-party services are getting configured it makes for a clunky developer experience trying to make sure all the disparate classes are invoked properly. This is a problem that can be solved by how we configure DefinitionProvider for bootstrapping.

We can introduce a `CompositeDefinitionProvider` that takes _n_ `DefinitionProvider` and run all of them. The XML configuration can be updated to allow configuration multiple `DefinitionProvider` instances. The Bootstrap can then compose an appropriate `CompositeDefinitionProvider` with the correct instances.

issue.title: Allow configuration file to specify definition providers and observers as package private
issue.body: In #144 the scanned vendor directories will have their observers and definition providers included. There might be a situation where a definition provider or observer should only be used by the library internally for some reason. We should allow the XML configuration to define a `packagePrivate=true` attribute on the `<observer>` and `<definitionProvider>` tags that the vendor scanning tool can use to respect a library's internal code.

issue.title: Add standardized method for scanning a vendor package
issue.body:
Annotated Container bootstrapping should include a standardized method for scanning vendor packages. Ideally, a configuration would allow specifying `vendor/package` and the framework takes care of everything else to determine the appropriate directories in the vendor directory to scan.

To determine the directories to scan we should, in priority order:

- Check for existence of an annotated-container configuration file in the root of the vendor package. If present use the source directories and vendor directories specified that are _not_ marked packagePrivate. Any directory to scan that is marked pacakgePrivate should not be scanned unless that configuration lives in the root project.
- Check for any directories set to autoload in the vendor's composer.json
- Fallback to scanning every single directory in the package's directory.

comment.body: I'm moving this to the 2.0 release because the quality of life from having this will be so significant it almost should be considered required. Initial apps created with Annotated Container were very promising but third-party definitions and observers are definitely a thorny part that should be improved.

issue.title: Deprecate the use of older class names

milestone.description: The Big Container Push. This release is focused primarily on integrating as many backing Container libraries as possible.

issue.body: In #182 the codebase will be organized into cleaner namespaces. The class names that were previously used should be deprecated and marked for removal in 3.0.

comment.body: This is no longer necessary, older class names will not be supported along with the new class names.

issue.title: Remove older class_aliases
issue.body: In #182 and #183 the codebase was organized into better namespaces and older classes deprecated. The deprecated class_alias should be removed.

comment.body: This was effectively done as part of the 2.0 release. Maintaining the older class aliases had several problems with it that weren't sustainable.

issue.title: Allow bootstrap observing to be profile aware
issue.body:
Bootstrap observers could benefit from knowing what profiles are active. For example, a cache busting observer could be added that clears out any cached container definition before compilation in appropriate profiles, say 'dev' or 'test', but allows the cached definition in 'prod'.

In addition to adding this data on to the appropriate `Bootstrap\Observer` interface methods. We should also consider whether to allow configured observers to define what profiles they're active for since this seems to be useful enough to expose as a first-class citizen.

comment.body: I'm moving this to the 2.0 release because it modifies the API of the `Observer` introduced in that version. Doing this now avoids unnecessary BC breaks in the future.
